channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cars ignoring Parking Restrictions, 18th September
item.description:
Cars are ignoring the parking restrictions in place parking opposite number 15, this is the narrowest point of Greenwood Close.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenwood Close, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Push button gets stuck, 18th September
item.description:
I've noticed a number of times that the push button on the left hand (facing away from the town centre) often gets stuck depressed, leading to the lights continual changing to red. This can be fixed by applying pressure to the button. This has been like this for at least 2 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rodney Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 18th September
item.description:
Customer reporting temp lights in the road that appear to be there for no reason as all works appear complete.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 18th September
item.description:
28 day with give and take plus temporary footway closure please lift and replace x1 broken kerb 900x150x20mm stats required. No parking cones required prior to works. Please note road narrows in nearby vicinity to defect. (CW Edge Kerbing & Channels)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road speed hump breaking up L/H side South. Can easily break a front left car suspension spring, 18th September
item.description:
Albert Road Pittville Cheltenham, before the first road speed restriction , by top entrance to the school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, East Approach Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Van parked on edge of road, limiting drivers' visibility and causing traffic, 18th September
item.description:
As soon as you turn into Lancaster road from Lobleys Drive, in front of number 1 and 3

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lancaster Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Out of Sequence, 18th September
item.description:
Traffic lights from Cheltenham side towards Gloucester are out of sinc giving priority from side roads for 3 mins then main road traffic 30 seconds causing serious blockages on Elmbridge roundabout with fast flowing traffic suddenly faced with traffic travelling from left or right direction suddenly stopping in the lane they are using to flow through the roundabout
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 18th September
item.description:
Customer reporting several barriers and a sandbag that have been left lying on the f/way for at least a month at location
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 18th September
item.description:
Customer reports that a team have been relaying tarmac at the location this morning. They advise they have "slapped down" the material and the surface is worse than it was previously (it's uneven): it is a poor job and there's no improvement. They have limited mobility and need a level surface. Please can Highways investigate.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 18th September
item.description:
Please pass to relevant ahr covering this area. As part of routine monthly driven inspection, found Permit Holders only parking sign is loose in foundations in footway. The surrounding slabs are not moving so is not at immediate risk of falling into the carriageway. Please arrange permanent repair of loose sign in footway.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 18th September

approx 5 streetlights out
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard shell is damaged/vandalised problem, 18th September
item.description:
Please pass to Street Lighting team for further investigation. Missing illuminated keep left bollard on island. This has previously been made safe with temporary keep left sign. No obvious damage to the base and no exposed wires observed. Please arrange replacement bollard to be installed at this location.
Report on FixMyStreet
